question2.description: [My therapist] and I agreed about the things I will need to do in therapy to help improve my situation.

question3.description: I was worried about the outcome of the sessions.

question4.description: What I was doing in therapy gave me new ways of looking at my problem.

question5.description: [My therapist] and I understood each other.

question6.description: [My therapist] perceived accurately what my goals were.

question7.description: I find what I was doing in therapy confusing.

question9.description: I wish [my therapist] and I could have clarified the purpose of our sessions.

question10.description: I disagreed with [my therapist] about what I ought to get out of therapy.

question11.description: I believe the time [my therapist] and I were spending together was not spent efficiently.

question12.description: [My therapist] did not understand what I was trying to accomplish in therapy.

question13.description: I was clear on what my responsibilities were in therapy.

question14.description: The goals of the sessions were important for me.

question15.description: I find what [my therapist] and I were doing in therapy was unrelated to my concerns.

question16.description: I feel that the things I did in therapy helped me to accomplish the changes that I wanted.

question17.description: I believe [my therapist] was genuinely concerned for my welfare.

question18.description: I was clear as to what [my therapist] wanted me to do in those sessions.

question19.description: [My therapist] and I respected each other.

question20.description: I feel that [my therapist] was not totally honest about his/her feelings toward me.

question21.description: I was confident in [my therapist]'s ability to help me.

question22.description: [My therapist] and I were working towards mutually agreed upon goals.

question23.description: I feel that [my therapist] appreciated me.

question24.description: We agreed on what was important for me to work on.

question25.description: As a result of the therapy I became clearer as to how I might be able to change.

question26.description: [My therapist] and I trusted one another.

question27.description: [My therapist] and I had different ideas on what my problems were.

question28.description: My relationship with [my therapist] was very important to me.

question29.description: I had the feeling that if I said or did the wrong things, [my therapist] would stop working with me.

question30.description: [My therapist] and I collaborated on setting goals for my therapy.

question31.description: I was frustrated by the things I was doing in therapy.

question32.description: We had a good understanding of the kind of changes that would be good for me.

question33.description: The things that [my therapist] was asking me to do did not make sense.

question34.description: I did not know what to expect as the result of my therapy.

question35.description: I believe the way we were working with my problem was correct.

question36.description: I feel [my therapist] cared about me even when I did things that he/she did not approve of.
